712644f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street - 6th Avenue
712644f-a.text:
40th Street, south side, and Bryant Park, east from Sixth to
Madison Avenues : an aerial view.
July 30, 1V30.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717902f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 40th Street
717902f-a.text:
Bryant Park: The snow covered lawn as
viewed westward from the rear nf the New York Public
Library. ~Sixth Avenue forms the westerly edge, with
West 40th Stre t on the left, and 42nd Street on the
right. Note the absence of the Sixth Avenue ''El'structure.
December 30, 1939
Nathan Schwartz
New Yor Public Library
Photostat Division
MAY BE REERODUS3ED

717933f-b.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 40th Street
717933f-b.text:
(1)
Bryant Park, looking southwest towards Sixth Avenue and 40th
Street, from the top of 500 Fifth Avenue at 42nd Street.
June 24, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, from the roof of the Public Library, showing the de-
molition of the Federal Hall replica built the previous spring
for the George Washington Bicentennial Celebration.
April 24, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same, from the roof of the Public Library, on the 42nd
Street side, showing the Park under reconstruction.
April 30, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

110, 112 West 40th Street, south side, west of Sixth Avenue.

713036f-b.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 40th Street
713036f-b.text:
Sixxth Avenue, east side, north from W. 40th Street,
showing the westerly extremity of Bryant Park. Buildings
in the background are on the north side of 42nd Street,
and axtend enstward townrds Fifth Avenue. The low center
Onit is SterA's Department store. Reconstruction work
in the Park was disturbed by the 6th Avcnue auhwav cons-
truction. Restoration after same occurred in 1940.
View 1: August 20, 1934
View 2: June 7, 1934
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

712675f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 6th Avenue
712675f-a.text:
54-56 West 4Oth Streot, south side, east of 6th Avenue, show-
ing the church structure that is to be replaced with the present
Ropublican Club Building.
Noto the Bryant Park fence in tho foreground.
Prior to 1902
Gift of Urbrock Collection

709463f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 40th Street (West)
709463f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, at W. 40th Street (right), showing ''El''
demolition, Bryant Park, and the rear of the New YYork Public
Library. To the left of the latter is the towering office
building, Nv. 500 Fifth Avenue. Adjacent to same is the
Salmon Tower Building. Outlined at the upper right are the
Lincoln and the Chrysler BuilUings. Note the wood planking
under foot that covers over subway construction. This activity
is being conducted simultaneously with the Sixth Avenue ''El''
demolition.
April 4, 1939
Mr. Nathan Schwartzz
New Iork Public Library
BE REPRO1OED

717900f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 40th Street
717900f-a.text:
Bryant Fark: An eastward view across same, from Sixth Ave. (fore-
ground) between West 40th (right) and 42nd (left) Streets, showing the
rear of the Central Building of the New York Public Library which faces
on the west side of Fifth Ave., as photographed at dusk (7 P.M.).
Across the low roof of the aforementioned educational institution are the
spires of the Chrysler, Lincoln, News, Lefcourt-Colonial, New York Trust
Company, and No. 10 East 40th Street Buildings.
March 17, 1938.
Mr. Nathan Schwartz.
New York Public Library.
MAY BE REPPODUCED.

712573f-a.text:
Fortieth Street and Sith Avenue (bottom of picture),
Manhattan.
The two large buildings (center) which dominate the
photograph are located on W. 39th Street, betw.
Sixth Avenue and froadway.
Taken from the Salmon lower, 11 West 42nd Street.
Federal Art Project
''Changing New York'

Sept. 8, 1938

712679f-a.text:
30th Street, between Sixth Avenue and Broaoway, an aerial view
showing the roofs of 104 and 106 West 40th Street and the east
side of the World's Tower Building, No. 110-112.
February 28, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REECPRODUCTIONS.

717934f-b.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 40th Street
717934f-b.text:
Bryant Park, southwestern cuarter, along 40th Street, seen from
Sixth Avenue at 41st Street.
May 10, 1930.
P. L. Spenr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
The same, seen from Sixth Avenue a little north of 41st Street,
and showing the fountain in its new location, during the re-
construction work carried out under Commissioner of Parks
Robert Moses.
On 40th Street, notice that the United Air Lines have recently
established a depot in the old brownstone house adjoining the
American Radiator Building.
April 30, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717934f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 40th Street
717934f-a.text:

717903f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 40th Street
717903f-a.text:
Bryant Park, looking west from the rear of the New York Public Library,
and showing the Park being drastically remodelled, under the
Nregime of Park Commissioner Robert Moses. The remarkable thing
about this job was the small size of the budget allowed for it and
the results accomplished nonetheless.
April 25, 1934.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

709461f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 40th Street (West)
709461f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, at W. 40th Street showing one of the last
stages oI the Sixth Avenue ''El'' demolition. Simultaneous with
this civic project is the subway construction underground. The
latter is eividenced by the temporary wood planking. The
photographer is viewing northeastward and towards Bryant Park,
the New York Public Library and W. 42nd Street Buildings. Vaguely
apparent at the upper right are the Lincoln and the Chrysler
Buildinge.
April 4, 1939
Mr. Nathan Schwartz
New York Public Library
MAY BE REPRODUCED
Neg A I379

709462f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 40th Street (West)
709462f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, at W. 40th Street, (right) showing ''El''
demmolition at this point. The photographer is viewing north-
eastward and shows across Bryant Park, buildings on the north
side of W. 42nd Sereet between this thoroughfare and Fifth Avenue.
From left to 1ight these are: Sterns Department Store, the former
Aeolian HHIall, the Salmon Tower and No. 500 Fifth Avenue. Nestling
beneath the latter is a wing of the New York Public Library.
April 4, 1939
Mr. Nathan Schwartz
New York Public Library
MAY BE REPROUCED

709459f.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 40th Street (West)
709459f.text:
Sixth Ave., east side, north from, but not including West 4Oth.,
to and including 42nd Streets. Shown on the right, is Bryant Park.
Men working, are placing a sheet wall on the western side of said park,
to protect underground aqueduct, in preparation for the excavation for
the new Municipal Sixth Ave., subway.
May 6, 1936.
Mr. Schwartz.
New Yomk Public LibrarY.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
The same, showing a more inclusive view. Notice the Sixth Ave.,
Elevated and Station at West 42nd Street. This structure will be
shored up during construction of subway and eventually demolished.
May 6, 1936.
Mr. Schwartz.
New York Public Library.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
